discover.role: SAP Commerce CX | Composable Storefront (Spartacus) Developer
responsibilities: Worked as a Front-end Developer on multiple enterprise projects using both SAP Spartacus and the legacy Hybris monolith architectures (JSP/JavaScript).

Joined a newly formed team and contributed to the stabilization of a critical Spartacus project, helping address existing issues, improve code quality, and deliver pending and new front-end functionalities.
Assisted in resolving a high volume of bugs and refactoring legacy code, contributing to improved platform stability and client satisfaction.
Implementated ASM (Assisted Service Module) and additional commerce features, including cart import/export and custom user flows.
Helped implement a multi-site, multi-catalog setup, enabling brand-specific look & feel while maintaining a unified platform.
Contributed to the development of the checkout experience for an enterprise healthcare e-commerce platform.
Assisted in implementing a complex multi-payment checkout flow, enabling the use of multiple credit cards with front-end–managed value distribution and installment logic.
Acted as a support point for other developers, assisting with programming questions and day-to-day technical challenges
Provided support for additional SAP Commerce monolith projects, contributing bug fixes, enhancements, and general technical assistance.
Collaborated with an international development team, supporting the delivery of a new store and communicating exclusively in English.
Implementation of the first SAP Spartacus & Telco Utilities Accelerator (TUA) application of the world, for a big client from the Telecom segment.
Collaborated closely with design and product teams to deliver meaningful, scalable front-end solutions.
Developed reusable, responsive, and maintainable front-end components.
Delivered high-quality, clean, and easy-to-maintain code following established best practices.
Implemented unit tests using Jasmine and Karma, maintaining a minimum code coverage of 80%.
Supported and guided less experienced developers through day-to-day technical assistance and knowledge sharing.
Designed and delivered an internal Angular study program to help team members strengthen their front-end skills.
Prepared and presented technical sessions on industry trends, best practices, development tooling, Angular, and SAP Spartacus.
Contributed to the architecture, implementation, and maintenance of web applications for a large telecom client using the Vue.js stack (Nuxt, Vuex).

Developed a front-end project from the ground up (MVNO) for a major telecom client, delivering a well-structured, fully tested codebase with a minimum of 80% code coverage, completing the project one week ahead of schedule.
Collaborated with design and product teams to deliver meaningful and scalable front-end solutions.
Developed reusable, responsive, and maintainable front-end components.
Delivered high-quality, clean, and easy-to-maintain code following established best practices.
Implemented unit tests using Jest, maintaining a minimum code coverage of 80%.
Supported and guided less experienced developers through technical assistance and knowledge sharing.
Developed an animation software for creating digital campaigns using Vue.js, Vuex, and Electron.js.
Acted as full-stack developer on a sales web application for managing and selling licenses of the animation software, using React.js, Node.js, AdonisJS, Redux, styled-components, and Docker.
Created landing pages for multiple clients using HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript.
Collaborated closely with the design team to ensure accurate implementation of UI/UX requirements.

projects.title: Projects
projects.subtitle: Some interesting projects that I have worked on.

ccg.title: Carhartt Company Gear
ccg.description: E-commerce platform developed for Carhartt, a U.S. heritage workwear brand. Contributed from inception to the new generation of Carhartt Company Gear (CCG), their B2B division. Responsibilities included defining the technical architecture, establishing coding standards, conducting code reviews, mentoring developers, and hands-on development.

carhartt.title: Carhartt
carhartt.description: Maintained and enhanced Carhartt's B2C e-commerce platform, supporting a high-traffic consumer storefront for a U.S. heritage workwear brand. Resolved production and performance bugs, implemented new features, and refactored legacy code to improve stability, scalability, and overall codebase quality in collaboration with cross-functional teams.

vivo.title: Vivo Store
vivo.description: E-commerce platform developed for Vivo (Telefónica), Brazil's largest telecom company. In a multi-consultancy project, I led Accenture's development team, delivering the world's first SAP Commerce implementation using SAP Composable Storefront with the Telco & Utilities Accelerator. Responsibilities included technical leadership, Accenture team training, architecture alignment, and hands-on development.

leap.title: Boston Scientific — LEAP+
leap.description: LEAP+ is a healthcare financing platform by Boston Scientific that, despite its appearance and segment, is a complex e-commerce marketplace built with SAP Composable Storefront. The platform supports multiple user roles — doctors, hospitals, manufacturers, and distributors — enabling integrated healthcare transactions. I led the development of the checkout, enabling payments with up to three credit cards, tackling complex business rules and validation requirements.

alliage.title: Alliage Global — 3-in-1 E-commerce Platform
alliage.description: SAP Commerce Cloud solution built for Alliage Global, designed as a single scalable platform supporting Dabi Atlante, Saevo, and D700 brands, each with a distinct look and feel driven by unique product and content catalogs. As a front-end developer, I worked with JSP and JavaScript, driving innovation by introducing a more client-side driven approach inspired by modern front-end architectures.
alliage.thumbAlt: Dabi Atlante, Saevo and D700 home pages

ml.title: Mercado Livre Copy — SAP Spartacus
ml.description: Personal project created to improve my SAP Composable Storefront (Spartacus) abilities. This project is a copy of the "Mercado Libre" E-commerce ("Mercado Livre" in Brazil), made with SAP Spartacus/Angular. To dedicate myself to client projects, I've never finished it, but who knows I do that someday.
ml.thumbAlt: Mercado livre in Spartacus home page

teams.title: Microsoft Teams Copy
teams.description: Personal project created when I was learning Angular. Nothing better than a project to teach us things that go beyond the docs, right? My first project made with Angular was nothing but a Microsoft Teams copy, completely interactive. You could send messages, react to messages, and other cool stuff messaging apps usually allow us to do.

finances.title: Monopoly Banker
finances.description: Personal project created during one of my job vacations. At some point I saw myself playing Monopoly with my niece and noticed how those physical bills were annoying, and that's the story behind the app. Monopoly Banker is an app for making money transfers between the players in real time, relying on the power of React, Node.js, Mongo and WebSocket. If you're interested in knowing more about it, there's a publication on my LinkedIn profile.

elderly.title: Aprenda Elderly — Learning platform
elderly.description: Created to be presented as my Capstone Project, Aprenda Elderly is a learning platform focused on older adults who want to learn more about modern devices like computers and smartphones.
